title: Bauhaus fonts
content: I am working on a design project centering around the architect and industrial designer Eileen Gray. She worked throughout the early 20th century, particularly the 20s and 30s, but greatly influenced many Art Deco and Bauhaus designers. I am struggling for what the best type choice would be for her. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated!
author: alderce0

comments.content:
Corbusier stencil:  
 [http://lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Headline+Fonts/Le+Corbusier/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130822193811/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Headline+Fonts/Le+Corbusier/ "http://lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Headline+Fonts/Le+Corbusier/")

Monotype Grotesque Light for text.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/grotesque-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130822193811/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/grotesque-mt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/grotesque-mt/")

The Corbusier font is the headline font in Eye #77.

This is a very nice set: [http://www.fountaintype.com/typefaces/dessau](http://web.archive.org/web/20130822193811/http:/www.fountaintype.com/typefaces/dessau "http://www.fountaintype.com/typefaces/dessau")
